item.title: 特朗普下令放松对美国渔业的监管
item.description: 美国白宫周四表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普发布了一项行政命令，旨在通过指示商务部放松监管和向商业捕捞开放海洋纪念碑来增加国内海产品产量。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump issued an executive order aimed at increasing domestic seafood production by directing the Commerce Department to loosen regulations and by opening up marine monuments to commercial fishing, the White House said on Thursday.】

item.title: 特斯拉就黑人员工指控其受到普遍骚扰的诉讼达成和解
item.description: 一名黑人女员工声称，特斯拉加利福尼亚州弗里蒙特工厂的一名经理有时会用 "欢迎来到种植园 "或 "欢迎来到奴隶屋 "来问候工人，特斯拉已就该员工的种族歧视诉讼达成和解。【原文：Tesla has settled a racial discrimination lawsuit by a Black female employee who claimed a manager at its Fremont, California, plant sometimes greeted workers by saying "welcome to the plantation" or "welcome to the slave house."】

item.title: 美联储建议平均大型银行压力测试结果以降低波动性
item.description: 美联储周四全面启动了对大型银行的年度压力测试的改革工作，建议在制定资本要求时采用两年的平均结果。【原文：The Federal Reserve kicked off a sweeping effort to overhaul its annual stress tests of large banks on Thursday, proposing to average results over two years in setting capital requirements.】

item.title: 联合健康的盈利表现值得信赖--直到其周四发布令人震惊的财报
item.description: 自 2008 年全球金融危机以来，UnitedHealth 的盈利从未低于预期，在投资者眼中一直是一家值得信赖的公司。【原文：UnitedHealth has traditionally been a company investors saw as reliable, having not missed earnings estimates since the 2008 global financial crisis.】

item.title: 立法者称摩根大通和美国银行应停止中国 CATL 的首次公开募股工作
item.description: 一位共和党议员周四表示，摩根大通和美国银行应退出中国电动汽车电池巨头CATL的首次公开募股工作。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co and Bank of America should withdraw from working on the initial public offering of Chinese electric vehicle battery giant CATL , a Republican lawmaker said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国诉讼称特斯拉加速里程表以避免保修维修
item.description: 特斯拉面临一项集体诉讼提案，该提案声称特斯拉加快了其电动汽车上里程表的速度，使其更快地超出保修期，从而使埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的公司免于支付维修费用。【原文：Tesla faces a proposed class action claiming it speeds up odometers on its electric vehicles so they fall out of warranty faster, saving Elon Musk's company from having to pay for repairs.】

item.title: 特朗普称中国已就关税问题伸出援手，TikTok 协议或将再等等
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周四表示，自美国对从中国进口的商品加征关税以来，中国已主动与美国进行了谈判。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Thursday that China has reached out to talk since the U.S. imposed tariffs on imports from the country.】

item.title: 特朗普表示怀疑美国钢铁与日本的协议是否会成为与日本贸易谈判的一部分
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，美国钢铁公司和新日本制铁公司之间的交易可能是与日本进行关税谈判的一部分，但他补充说，他怀疑会是这样。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that a deal between U.S. Steel and Nippon Steel could be a part of tariff negotiations with Japan, but added he doubted it would be.】

item.title: 交易日：欧洲央行采取行动，特朗普发起攻击
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 特朗普媒体敦促美国监管机构调查其股票空头头寸
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）拥有多数股权的媒体公司特朗普媒体与科技集团（Trump Media & Technology Group）周四表示，已要求美国证券交易委员会（SEC）调查其股票最近的空头头寸。【原文：The media company majority owned by President Donald Trump, Trump Media & Technology Group , said on Thursday it had asked the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to investigate a recent short position in its stocks.】

item.title: Netflix 季度业绩超出华尔街目标，收入前景乐观
item.description: 周四，Netflix 的季度业绩超出华尔街预期，并提出了乐观的收入展望，在唐纳德-特朗普总统反复无常的关税计划所带来的经济不确定性中显示出信心。【原文：Netflix exceeded Wall Street expectations for quarterly results and offered a bullish revenue outlook on Thursday, signaling confidence amid the economic uncertainty surrounding President Donald Trump's erratic tariff plans.】

item.title: Blackstone 另类投资部门 BXMA 第一季度报告增长 2.3
item.description: 作为全球最大的对冲基金投资者，黑石集团的多元资产投资部门 BXMA 在第一季度获得了 2.3% 的扣除费用后回报率，远远超过 HFRX 全球对冲基金指数 0.53% 的回报率。【原文：Blackstone Group's multi-asset investing BXMA unit, the world's largest investor in hedge funds, posted a 2.3% return after fees in the first quarter, handily outpacing the HFRX Global Hedge Fund Index 0.53% return.】

item.title: 解说：对谷歌非法广告技术垄断的裁决意味着什么？
item.description: 美国法官裁定谷歌在广告技术领域存在非法垄断，这为美国检察官寻求与谷歌分手埋下了伏笔。以下是此案涉及的内容以及谷歌所有者 Alphabet 今后将面临的问题。【原文：A U.S. judge's ruling that Google has illegal monopolies in ad technology sets up the possibility of U.S. prosecutors seeking a breakup. Here's what the case involves and what Google owner Alphabet faces from here.】

item.title: 据 Coindesk 报道，Kraken 在首次公开募股前裁员数百人
item.description: 据 Coindesk 周四报道，加密货币交易所 Kraken 在过去几个月中已在其所有业务领域裁员数百人，以便在计划上市前精简业务。【原文：Cryptocurrency exchange Kraken has laid off hundreds of employees in the past several months across all areas of its business to streamline its operations ahead of its planned IPO, Coindesk reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国国务院称，美国希望刚果矿产交易有私营部门合作伙伴的参与
item.description: 美国国务院发言人塔米-布鲁斯（Tammy Bruce）周四表示，美国预计正在与刚果民主共和国（DRC）谈判的矿产交易将涉及一系列私营部门合作伙伴。【原文：The United States expects a minerals deal being negotiated with the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) will involve a range of private sector partners, State Department spokesperson Tammy Bruce said on Thursday.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称，特朗普曾与被视为可能继任者的沃什讨论过解雇美联储主席鲍威尔的问题
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四报道，唐纳德-特朗普总统已私下讨论解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔数月之久，并与前美联储理事凯文-沃什（Kevin Warsh）谈论过此事，包括随后选择沃什接替鲍威尔的可能性。【原文：President Donald Trump has privately discussed firing Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell for months and talked about it with former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, including the possibility of then selecting Warsh as Powell's replacement, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 谷歌从宿舍到互联网霸主的历程
item.description: 一名美国法官裁定，谷歌非法垄断了数字广告市场，为这个近 27 年前从斯坦福大学宿舍起家的互联网帝国的解体铺平了道路。【原文：A U.S. judge has ruled that Google illegally monopolized digital advertising markets, paving the way for a break up of the internet empire that was started out of a Stanford University dormitory nearly 27 years ago.】

item.title: GTCR 将从 Worldpay 242.5 亿美元的出售中获得丰厚的意外之财
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周四表示，私募股权公司 GTCR 向 Global Payments 出售其在支付处理商 Worldpay 55% 的股份后，有望获得约两倍于其投资的回报。【原文：Private equity firm GTCR is poised to garner a return of about two times its investment in Worldpay, after the sale of its 55% stake in the payments processor to Global Payments, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普下令叫停纽约风电项目，令近海产业目瞪口呆，并威胁到其他项目
item.description: 周三晚些时候，特朗普政府决定叫停 Equinor 在纽约海岸的 Empire Wind 1 号风电场的建设，这在海上风电行业引起了震动，使人们担心代表着数十亿投资的已获完全许可的开发项目并不安全。【原文：The Trump administration's decision to halt construction of Equinor's Empire Wind 1 farm off the coast of New York late on Wednesday sent shockwaves through the offshore wind industry, raising concerns that fully-permitted developments representing billions in investment aren't safe.】

item.title: 对美国法官裁定谷歌非法垄断广告技术的反应
item.description: 一名法官周四裁定，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌非法主导了两个在线广告技术市场，这对这家科技巨头造成了又一次打击，并为美国反垄断检察官寻求拆分其广告产品铺平了道路。【原文：Alphabet's Google illegally dominates two markets for online advertising technology, a judge ruled on Thursday, dealing another blow to the tech giant and paving the way for U.S. antitrust prosecutors to seek a breakup of its advertising products.】

item.title: 特朗普称乌克兰谈判后将于下周四签署矿产协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周四表示，美国将于下周四签署一项新的矿产协议，这显然是指与乌克兰的谈判。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Thursday that the U.S. would sign a new minerals deal next Thursday, in an apparent reference to talks with Ukraine.】

item.title: 花旗将三个月黄金目标价格上调至每盎司 3,500 美元
item.description: 花旗研究公司（Citi Research）周四在一份报告中称，在关税风险和市场疲软的背景下，中国保险商的新一轮买盘和避险资金的流入将未来三个月的黄金价格目标从每盎司3200美元上调至3500美元。【原文：Citi Research raised its gold price target for the next three months to $3,500 per ounce from $3,200, led by fresh buying from Chinese insurers and safe-haven flows amid tariff risks and market weakness, it said in a note on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普称，如果他要求美联储主席鲍威尔离职，鲍威尔就会离职
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周四表示，他相信如果特朗普要求美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔离职，他就会离职。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Thursday he believes Federal Reserve chairman Jerome Powell will leave his job if Trump asks him to do so.】

item.title: 据《华盛顿邮报》报道，苹果公司首席执行官与卢特尼克就关税对 iPhone 价格的影响进行了交谈
item.description: 据《华盛顿邮报》周四援引两位熟悉电话内容的人士的话报道，苹果公司首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）上周与美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）就美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策对 iPhone 价格的潜在影响进行了交谈。【原文：Apple CEO Tim Cook spoke with U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick last week about the potential impact of President Donald Trump's tariffs on iPhone prices, the Washington Post reported on Thursday, citing two people familiar with the phone call.】

item.title: 被特朗普排除在关税之外后，黄金开始从美国返回瑞士
item.description: 官方数据显示，为防范美国可能对进口金条征收广泛关税，自12月以来，交易商们一直将黄金运往纽约。【原文：Gold, which traders have been flying to New York since December as a precaution against the possibility of broad U.S. tariffs hitting bullion imports, is being shipped back to Switzerland, where it came from, official data shows.】

item.title: 特朗普我们将与中国达成贸易协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，他希望与中国达成一项贸易协议，但他没有提供具体细节，也没有表明在两个超级大国明显陷入僵局的情况下将如何展开谈判。【原文：President Donald Trump on Thursday said he expects to make a trade deal with China, though he offered no specifics or indications of how talks would get underway with the two superpowers at an apparent impasse.】

item.title: MP 材料公司因关税问题停止运往中国的稀土货物
item.description: MP Materials 公司周四表示，已停止向中国运输稀土精矿，以应对报复性关税和出口管制，该公司股价在午后交易中下跌了 6.3%。【原文：MP Materials said on Thursday it had stopped shipping rare earth concentrate to China, in response to retaliatory tariffs and export controls, sending its shares down 6.3% in afternoon trading.】

item.title: 贝克休斯称美国钻井商四周来首次增加油气钻机
item.description: 能源服务公司贝克休斯（Baker Hughes）周四在其密切关注的报告中称，美国能源公司本周增加了石油和天然气钻机，这是四周以来的首次。【原文：U.S. energy firms this week added oil and natural gas rigs for the first time in four weeks, energy services firm Baker Hughes said in its closely followed report on Thursday.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社：美国财政部正与联邦机构商谈放松银行监管事宜
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）正在与联邦和其他银行机构举行非公开会议，这是他为简化监督和协调放松监管计划而扩大努力的一部分。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent is hosting private meetings with federal and other bank agencies as a part of his expanded effort to streamline oversight and coordinate plans to ease regulation, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普称乌克兰-美国矿产协议可能在下周签署
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，乌克兰和美国最快将于下周签署双方一直在谈判的矿产和经济合作协议。【原文：Ukraine and the U.S. could sign the minerals and economic cooperation deal they've been negotiating as soon as next week, President Donald Trump said on Thursday.】
